meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for travel on a road.
meanings.sent1: The roadability of the car made it easy to drive on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The roadability of the bicycle allowed it to smoothly navigate the city streets.
meanings.sent3: The roadability of the skateboard was so good that it practically glided on the pavement.
meanings.sent4: Her shoes had the roadability of a race car, propelling her forward with each step.
meanings.sent5: The roadability of the bus was so impressive that passengers felt like they were floating on air.

meanings.definition: The ability of a vehicle to perform well on roads.
meanings.sent1: The off-road vehicle's roadability was unmatched, handling rough terrain effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The sports car's roadability on the track impressed all the spectators.
meanings.sent3: The roadability of the tractor in the race against the sports cars was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: His motorcycle had the roadability of a cheetah, speeding through traffic with agility.
meanings.sent5: The roadability of the truck was so reliable that it never faltered on long journeys.
